Title.evidence: The POWER Trial: A Randomised Controlled Trial on Pre-Operative Endocrine Therapy in Early-Stage Breast Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised controlled trial was conducted at [study setting].

Participants.evidence: Participants were older women with early-stage, ER-positive breast cancer.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention group received pre-ET, while the control group did not.

Objective.evidence: investigates whether 3 months of pre-operative endocrine therapy (pre-ET) informs adjuvant radiation therapy decisions in older women with early-stage, ER-positive breast cancer.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in Ki-67 expression, measured over 3 months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using [randomisation method] with allocation concealment by [method].

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Thirty-seven participants completed pre-ET and surgery.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Ki-67 expression decreased from 13% to 5% (p<0.001), and cellularity decreased from 40% to 23% (p<0.001).
